I've spent the last 7 years working in digital strategy, business intelligence and marketing analytics.

From 2012 to 2019 I got the awesome opportunity to work for 2 of the most popular automotive brands in the world and on 2020, while finishing my master's degree, I changed gears and went on to do consulting work for Rappi (one of Latam's biggest startups) and Planet Fitness (one of the largest gym chains in the US).

Currently I'm working for Corsair as a Marketing Analytics specialist for their E-commerce platform.

blogPost.title: Diputados MX. Pt I
blogPost.description: Re-thinking the way in which Mexican users can find their congressman data.
blogPost.content:
The sole purpose of this project is to rethink the UX of the ðŸ‡²ðŸ‡½  congress website.
The site has a lot of important content but it's not very intuitive for users. Especially if you are accessing through a mobile device such as a smartphone. Considering that a high percentage of the Mexican population has access to the internet via a smartphone, is important that congress data is highly accessible through this channel.

Series

**1. Data Gathering**
- Data Collection Using Python-Requests
- Data Manipulation Using Pandas
- Model Design for SQL deployment

**2. Creating a VM and Uploading Data**
- Creating an Azure VM
- Creating a Dockerfile with FastAPI, Postgresql, pgAdmin and Strapi
- Upload data to Postgresql

**3.  Designing the UX**
-  Tailwind base project
- FastAPI templating. 

**4.  Getting a Domain Name & SSL Certificates**
-  Grabbing  a name from a DNS provider
- Setting up NGINX on our VM to reverse proxies on the site
- Using Certbot to certify our domains

blogPost.title: Diputados MX. Part II
blogPost.description: Scrapping the ðŸ‡²ðŸ‡½ congress site using Python.
blogPost.content:
The most impÃ²rtant part of this project was getting the data. The Congress Website has all kinds of interesting data but sometimes is kind of confusing. 

I proceeded to scrape the site using the `requests-html` library. This library has great flexibility and it's easy to learn. Here's the [**documentation**](https://docs.python-requests.org/projects/requests-html/en/latest/) is a library that helps with the scrapping process. 

Before starting any kind of python project, we must create a python virtual environment. The virtual environment helps us to isolate our project from the rest of our files and assure reproducibility. 

```python
#  Create the Virtual Environment using venv. 
python3 -m venv env

# Activating the virtual environment
source env/bin/activate
```
Once the Virtual Environment is created, we proceed to create our `requirements.txt` file

```bash
touch requirements.txt
```
This file contains all the libraries required for this project. 

```
#requirements.txt
ipykernel
pandas
requests-html
```
